senses.de: The action or process of paying for goods or services purchased at a store.
senses.ex: Please proceed to the checkout to pay for your groceries.

Tips.title: At a physical store
Tips.description: Use 'checkout' to refer to the area designated for paying.
Tips.example: The checkout line was long on Saturday.

Tips.title: Online Shopping
Tips.description: Use 'checkout' to describe the process of finalizing an online purchase.
Tips.example: I abandoned my online shopping cart during checkout.

senses.de: The time by which someone must leave a hotel room or other rented accommodation.

Tips.title: Hotel Stays
Tips.description: Use 'checkout' to refer to the designated time for vacating a hotel room.
Tips.example: We requested a late checkout so we could enjoy the hotel amenities a bit longer.

senses.de: The act of borrowing something, especially a library book.
senses.ex: The librarian scanned my books at the checkout desk.

Tips.title: Library Borrowing
Tips.description: Use 'checkout' to refer to borrowing books or other materials from a library.
Tips.example: The maximum checkout period for this book is two weeks.

payment.wordDefinition: 'Checkout' refers to the process, while 'payment' refers to the actual transfer of money.

departure.wordDefinition: In the context of hotels, 'checkout' is a specific type of departure related to the formal process of leaving and settling the bill.

borrowing.wordDefinition: In a library context, 'checkout' is the specific term used for borrowing materials.
